description:
Normal appearance, normal intelligence, normal in arts and sports... just normal. This is the entirely normal 14-year-old, Naru Sekiya. While she admires "Heroines" she continues to live a normal life until one moonlit night she meets a fairy. This foreign girl then guides her into the extraordinary world of the yosakoi dance.

(Source: Manga Time Kirara)

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Dancing
tags.description: Centers around the art of dance.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Iyashikei
tags.description: Primary aim is to heal the audience through serene depictions of characters' daily lives.

tags.name: Band
tags.description: Main cast is a group of musicians.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

name.native: ハナ・N・フォンテーンスタンド
ジェニファー・N・フォンテーンスタンド

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/いしづかあつこ) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atsuko_Ishizuka)

Affiliated with [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/).

Known for directing shows such as [A Place Further Than the Universe](https://anilist.co/anime/99426/), and [No Game No Life](https://anilist.co/anime/19815/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/吉田玲子) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reiko_Yoshida)

Yoshida has written and supervised numerous scripts for anime series, live-action dramas and films. Her major works include [Kaleido Star](https://anilist.co/anime/427), [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477), [Maria-sama ga Miteru](https://anilist.co/anime/158), [D.Gray-man](https://anilist.co/anime/1482), [K-On!](https://anilist.co/anime/5680), [Bakuman](https://anilist.co/anime/7674) and [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131). In more recent works, she has supervised the screenplays for [Majestic Prince](https://anilist.co/anime/15863), [Non Non Biyori](https://anilist.co/anime/17549), [A Town Where You Live](https://anilist.co/anime/17741), [Tamako Market](https://anilist.co/anime/16417), [Yowamushi Pedal](https://anilist.co/anime/18179) and [Castle Town Dandelion](https://anilist.co/anime/20951). In films, she wrote the screenplay for Ghibli's [The Cat Returns](https://anilist.co/anime/597), the original films that would make up [Digimon: The Movie](https://anilist.co/anime/2961), Kyoto Animation’s hit anime film [A Silent Voice](https://anilist.co/anime/20954), and the film adaptations of Osamu Tezuka's [Buddha](https://anilist.co/anime/7014), the last one's [second film](https://anilist.co/anime/20500) was given a stamp of approval by the Dalai Lama.

Among her works, she was recognized for Best Screenplay/Original Work for [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131) at the Tokyo Anime Award Festival in 2014, and she won another Best Screenplay/Original Work award in 2017. In 2018, she wrote the screenplay for [Violet Evergarden](https://anilist.co/anime/21827) which aired on TV in Japan and is licensed by Netflix.

Yoshida also wrote the story for the manga series [Tokyo Mew Mew](https://anilist.co/manga/30554).

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Website](https://monaca.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_jp)

__MONACA__ is a Japanese music production studio, which was established by the composer Keiichi Okabe in October 2004.

__Members__:
• [Keiichi Okabe](https://anilist.co/staff/121585/Keiichi-Okabe) (CEO)
• [Satoru Kousaki](https://anilist.co/staff/101555/Satoru-Kousaki)
• [Ryuuichi Takada](https://anilist.co/staff/109459/Ryuuichi-Takada)
• [Kakeru Ishihama](https://anilist.co/staff/150946/Kakeru-Ishihama)
• [Hidekazu Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/141852/Hidekazu-Tanaka)
• [Keiichi Hirokawa](https://anilist.co/staff/156490/Keiichi-Hirokawa)
• [Kuniyuki Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/154774/Kuniyuki-Takahashi)
• [Shuotarou Seo](https://anilist.co/staff/317330/Shoutarou-Seo)
• [Oliver Good](https://anilist.co/staff/317296)
• [Keita Inoue](https://anilist.co/staff/229376/Keita-Inoue)

__Past Members__:
• [Yuri Mitsumi](https://anilist.co/staff/201236/Yuri-Misumi)
• [Keigo Hoashi](https://anilist.co/staff/111233/Keigo-Hoashi)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nabe_atsu_live)

[Profile (81 Produce)](https://www.81produce.co.jp/dcms_plusdb/index.php/item?cell003=%E3%81%9F%E8%A1%8C&cell029=%E5%A5%B3%E6%80%A7&keyword=&cell028=&cell004=&name=%E7%94%B0%E4%B8%AD%E3%80%80%E7%BE%8E%E6%B5%B7&id=242&label=1) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/minazou_373) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/minazou_in_sta/)

Announced her marriage on November 22, 2023.

**Non-anime roles:**
- [Alice](https://anilist.co/character/292758/Tendou-Alice) - Blue Archive (Video Game)
- Linaria - Granblue Fantasy (Video Game)
- Urakaze, Wakaba - Azur Lane (Video Game)
- Rover (Female) - Wuthering Waves (Video Game)

[Profile](http://earlywing.co.jp/talent_w/otsuboyuka.php) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/00tsubo_yuka) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/43ZsqoTPYf5cc4ae3KPVuU?autoplay=true)

Yuka Ootsubo is a Japanese voice actress and singer affiliated with Early Wing. In 2014, she started her career as a singer by joining the band SmileY inc. with Vocaloid musician Yuuyu-P. She also did the voice of Vocaloid character Azuki Masaoka for V4.

__Non-anime roles:__
- Kaalaa Baunaa - Reverse 1999 (VG)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kaayaataaaan) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kaayaataaaan/)

[Website](http://www.lantis.jp/reinaueda) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ReinaUeda_Staff)

Reina Ueda is a Japanese voice actress and singer who is affiliated with 81 Produce. Beginning her career as a voice actress in 2012, her first main role was Naru Sekiya, the protagonist of the 2014 anime series Hanayamata. She is also known for her roles in video games such as Atelier Lydie & Suelle, Azur Lane, or Granblue Fantasy. She was one of the recipients of the Best New Actress Award in the 9th Seiyu Awards in 2015. She released a mini-album in 2016, and her first solo single in 2018.

**Non anime roles:**
- [Ganyu](https://anilist.co/character/233410/) - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Faira - Neptunia Virtual Stars (VG)
- Lee Nabi - SoulWorker (VG)
- Honami Mochizuki - Project Sekai: Colorful Stage! (VG)
- Alisa - Soul Tide (VG)
- [Mio Hirahara](https://anilist.co/character/215834/) - Blue Reflection Tie (VG)
- [Veyle](https://anilist.co/character/313599/) - Fire Emblem Engage (VG)
- Scarlet - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- [Sparkle](https://anilist.co/character/349492) - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
- Izumo - Azur Lane (VG)
- Pengy - Granblue Fantasy (VG)
- Rosa - Arknights (VG)
- Snow White - SINoAlice (VG)
- Mrs. Sweet Cake - No.1 Sentai Gozyuger (TV series)

__Height:__ 162 cm (5'4")

[Profile](http://www.artsvision.co.jp/talent/715/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/numakura_manami) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nu_manami/) | [Blog](http://blog.livedoor.jp/mnm_n_/) 

A voice actor affiliated with Arts Vision. She is married to fellow seiyuu [Ryouta Oosaka](https://anilist.co/staff/110743) as of October 23, 2019.

Two-member unit of Yuka Ootsubo and Vocaloid song producer Yuuyu who is best known for his 2010 Hatsune Miku song "Shinkai Shoujo".

(Source: MyAnimeList)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/7miura7)

Nana Miura is an animator.

__Doujinshi Circle:__ Sekitou (赤橙) 

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sou_hmymb)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/いしづかあつこ) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atsuko_Ishizuka)

Affiliated with [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/).

Known for directing shows such as [A Place Further Than the Universe](https://anilist.co/anime/99426/), and [No Game No Life](https://anilist.co/anime/19815/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/wasabi322) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hinatamasaki/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/masaki.hinata.1)

Formerly affiliated with [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/).

[Twitter](https://x.com/KeigoHoashi)

Keigo Hoashi is a composer and arranger, and a pianist. He was formerly part of the unit [MONACA](https://anilist.co/staff/110481/MONACA).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/吉田玲子) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reiko_Yoshida)

Yoshida has written and supervised numerous scripts for anime series, live-action dramas and films. Her major works include [Kaleido Star](https://anilist.co/anime/427), [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477), [Maria-sama ga Miteru](https://anilist.co/anime/158), [D.Gray-man](https://anilist.co/anime/1482), [K-On!](https://anilist.co/anime/5680), [Bakuman](https://anilist.co/anime/7674) and [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131). In more recent works, she has supervised the screenplays for [Majestic Prince](https://anilist.co/anime/15863), [Non Non Biyori](https://anilist.co/anime/17549), [A Town Where You Live](https://anilist.co/anime/17741), [Tamako Market](https://anilist.co/anime/16417), [Yowamushi Pedal](https://anilist.co/anime/18179) and [Castle Town Dandelion](https://anilist.co/anime/20951). Among her works, she was recognized for Best Screenplay/Original Work for [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131) at the Tokyo Anime Award Festival in 2014, and she won another Best Screenplay/Original Work award in 2017. In 2018, she wrote the screenplay for [Violet Evergarden](https://anilist.co/anime/21827) which aired on TV in Japan and is licensed by Netflix.

Yoshida also wrote the story for the manga series [Tokyo Mew Mew](https://anilist.co/manga/30554).

(Source: Wikipedia)
Kenji Nakamoto is an animation producer.

__[Profile (MONACA)](http://www.monaca.jp/staff/takada.html)__

__Ryuuichi Takada__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and member of music unit MONACA. He mainly composes and arranges for videogames, having worked on the soundtracks for Soul Calibur, Tekken, Katamari Damacy, and The iDOLM@STER.

__Eiko Morikawa__ is a Japanese sound effects editor. She started working at Swara Production, then went to Rakuonsha, and now is the representative director of Chura Sound.

(Source: AniDB)
Kimura Kashiko is an editor working for Mad Box.
